  • Constructor Details

    • Event

      public Event()
      No argument Event constructor

    • Event

      public Event(String name, String description, String location, com.google.firebase.Timestamp eventDate, com.google.firebase.Timestamp regDeadline, int maxEntrants, EventCallback callback) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Event constructor
      Parameters:
      name - Name of the event
      description - Description of the event
      location - Location of the event
      eventDate - Date of the event
      regDeadline - Deadline for registering for the event
      maxEntrants - Maximum number of entrants in the event
      callback - Callback for when the event is created
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the event time is in the past or the registration deadline is in the past or after the event time

    • Event

      regDeadline - Deadline for registering for the event
      maxEntrants - Maximum number of entrants in the event
      flag - Flag for testing purposes
      callback - Callback for when the event is created

    • addEntrant

      public boolean addEntrant(Entrant entrant, DBWriteCallback callback)
      Adds an entrant directly to the event This should only be used internally for testing or by the lottery
      Parameters:
      entrant - Entrant to add
      callback - Callback for database write completion
      Returns:
      True if entrant added successfully, false otherwise

    • doLottery

      public void doLottery(DBWriteCallback callback)
      Method that does the lottery May have issues with robustness specifically in restoring the lists in the event of a failure
      Parameters:
      callback - Callback to call when the lottery is complete

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo(Event other)
      Comparison method so events can be sorted by the earliest date first
      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface Comparable<Event>
      Parameters:
      other - Other event to compare to
      Returns:
      Returns invalid input: '<'1, 0, or >1 if the other event is before, at the same time, or after this event
